Other times, online resources are a helpful addition to other therapeutic services. While visiting our site, please consider taking an anonymous mental health screener, or look at the following resources for stress, anxiety, depression, suicidal thoughts, grief and loss, or tragedy. These are not a replacement for therapy, but we hope they help to point you in the right direction.           Coping with Stress Related to COVID-19  Social media and other online resources have no shortage of ideas for how to handle stress in the era of COVID-19. While this is positive in many ways, we are aware that integrating these suggestions can be overwhelming. The Counseling Center staff has compiled the following list of both general ideas for coping, as well as situation-specific suggestions.   Click here for tips on coping with stress related to COVID-19        Anonymous  Mental Health Screening Tool      Mental Health Resource Information           Stress             Anxiety             Depression             Suicidal Thoughts             Grief and Loss             Tragedy          Videos           Koru Mindfulness Meditation Videos             Self-Compassion Meditation Videos             Yoga Videos             Additional Meditations          Commuter Podcasts           Connecting with Others             Commuter-Related Stress             A Guided Meditation for Your Commute               Maintain health and balance by integrating self-care into your routine!
